description: SOP for handling crypto send and receive issues

scenarios.root_cause: Insufficient balance, wrong address format, or network congestion
scenarios.resolution: Verify wallet address format matches the network. Check minimum send amount. Check network status.
scenarios.script_en: Please verify: 1) The wallet address is correct and matches the network (e.g., ERC-20 for Ethereum), 2) You meet the minimum send amount, 3) You have sufficient balance including network fees.

scenarios.root_cause: User sent crypto on wrong blockchain network (e.g., sent ERC-20 to BSC address)
scenarios.resolution: Unfortunately, cross-network sends cannot be reversed. Escalate to engineering for possible recovery (depends on network).
scenarios.script_en: Sending crypto to the wrong network may result in permanent loss. We'll escalate this to our technical team to investigate if recovery is possible. Please note that recovery is not guaranteed.

scenarios.scenario: Crypto send stuck — pending for too long
scenarios.root_cause: Network congestion or low gas fee
scenarios.resolution: Check blockchain explorer for transaction hash. If broadcast, it will confirm when network clears. If not broadcast, may need to retry.
scenarios.script_en: Your transaction is pending on the blockchain. During high network activity, confirmations can take longer. Please check the transaction status using the transaction hash provided.

symptoms: Deposited crypto but balance not updated
scenarios.root_cause: Deposit requires minimum confirmations, or deposit to unsupported token/network
scenarios.resolution: Check required confirmations (BTC: 3, ETH: 12). If confirmed enough, escalate to engineering.
scenarios.script_en: Crypto deposits require a minimum number of blockchain confirmations (BTC: 3, ETH: 12). Once confirmed, the balance will automatically update. If the required confirmations have passed, please share the transaction hash.

symptoms: Sent unsupported token to Pluang address
scenarios.root_cause: User sent an unsupported ERC-20/BEP-20 token to their Pluang address
scenarios.resolution: Recovery depends on token and network. Escalate to engineering. Recovery may incur gas fees.
scenarios.script_en: Pluang only supports specific cryptocurrencies. If you sent an unsupported token, we'll escalate to our technical team to investigate recovery options. Please note recovery may not be possible for all tokens.

scenarios.scenario: User cannot access authenticator for crypto send
scenarios.root_cause: User lost phone or reset authenticator app without backup
scenarios.resolution: Identity verification required. Once verified, disable authenticator and ask user to re-setup.
scenarios.script_en: For security, we need to verify your identity before disabling the authenticator. Please provide: 1) Selfie with ID card, 2) Screenshot of last transaction, 3) Registered email confirmation.

scenarios.root_cause: Time sync issue on device, or QR code expired
scenarios.resolution: Ensure device time is set to automatic. Generate new QR code. Try manual key entry if QR fails.
scenarios.script_en: Please ensure your phone's time is set to 'Automatic'. Then try: 1) Generate a new QR code in the app, 2) If QR scanning fails, use the manual key entry option.
